newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: 13 bln rand S.African asset swaps completed -paper.
newsitem.headline: 13 bln rand S.African asset swaps completed -paper.

text.p: South African asset swaps worth at least 13 billion rand have been completed out of approved swaps worth 20 billion rand, the Business Day newspaper reported on Thursday.

The paper, quoting figures obtained from the Reserve Bank, said the 13 billion rand was an "absolute minimum" since the data was based on reports submitted by institutions at varying intervals, and was therefore not exact.
In terms of exchange controls liberalisation announced in June this year, institutions are able to swap up to 10 percent of their local assets for offshore investments.
This would translate into about 53 billion rand, according to Reserve Bank Quarterly Bulletin asset figures for the life, pensions and unit trust industries, the paper said.
